key_facts: January 2024 was the hottest month ever recorded.
Global temperatures were 1.75°C above pre-industrial levels.
La Niña failed to offset rising temperatures.
The planet is nearing the 1.5°C Paris Agreement threshold.
Extreme heat is intensifying wildfires, floods, and heatwaves.
Ocean temperatures remain high due to past El Niño events.
Fossil fuel burning is the main driver of global warming.
Experts call for urgent climate action.
Small temperature increases have major ecological and societal impacts.
